events.name: voting
events.definition: method for a group such as a meeting or an electorate to make a decision or express an opinion
events.template: <A0_pag_agent_voter> voted for <A1_ppt_theme_candidate_or_ballot_issue> candidate on <A1_ppt_theme_candidate_or_ballot_issue> ballot with <A2_prd_result_numerical_count_of_vote> results in <AM_loc__location> place

events.name: Submitting_documents
events.definition: A Submittor gives Documents to an Authority so that they can be processed as part of an application, evaluation or other official or bureaucratic process.   'I  was sure I had passed as soon as I handed in the test. DNI'  'She stated that she turned in the paperwork yesterday.'  'After the applicant's submission to the department, the department chairperson must evaluate.'  'I acknowledge my submission of the Material to you shall not lead to a concurrent review by any of your affiliate and subsidiary channels.'
events.template: <A0_pag_agent_giver> submitted <A1_ppt_theme_given> document(s) to <A2_gol-recipient-given_to> authority for the purpose of <A3_prp__purpose> in <AM_loc__location> place

events.name: nomination
events.definition: part of the process of selecting a candidate
events.template: <A0_pag_agent_nominator> nominates <A1_ppt_theme_candidate> candidate for <A2_prd_result_role_of_arg1>  role in <AM_loc__location> place

events.name: ratification
events.definition: process of giving effect to documentation in international law
events.template: <A0_pag__approver> ratifies <A1_ppt__entity_ratified> document or proposal constructed by <A2_gol__beneficiary> in <AM_loc__location> place

events.name: referendum
events.definition: direct and universal vote in which an entire electorate is invited to vote on a particular proposal
events.template: <A0_pag_agent_voter> voted for <A1_ppt_theme_candidate_or_ballot_issue> candidate on <A1_ppt_theme_candidate_or_ballot_issue> ballot with <A2_prd_result_numerical_count_of_vote> results in <AM_loc__location> place

events.name: appeal
events.definition: resort to a superior court to review the decision of an inferior court or administrative agency
events.template: <A0_pag__appealer> appeals to <A2_gol__appealed_to> court to review the <A1_ppt__decision_disagreed_with> decision in <AM_loc__location> place

events.name: redistribution
events.definition: process by which electoral districts are added, removed, or otherwise changed
events.template: <A0_pag__distributor> agent redistributes <A1_ppt__entity_redistributed> electoral districts in <AM_loc__location> place

events.name: convention
events.definition: meeting of a group of individuals and/or companies in a certain field
events.template: <A0_pag_agent_entity_calling_the_meeting> calls the <A1_ppt_theme_the_meeting_itself> meeting in <AM_loc__location> place

events.name: impeachment
events.definition: formal process in which an official is accused of unlawful activity
events.template: <A0_pag_agent_impeacher> officials accuse the <A1_ppt_theme_impeached> of <A2_prd_attribute_crime> unlawful activity in <AM_loc__location> place

events.name: primary election
events.definition: election that narrows the field of candidates before an election for office
events.template: <A0_pag_agent_voters> vote for <A1_ppt_theme_candidate> who is running for <A2_prd_result_office_or_position> in <AM_loc__location> place

events.name: debate
events.definition: argument, or discussion, usually in an ordered or formal setting, often with more than two people, generally ending with a vote or other decision
events.template: <A0_pag_agent_discussants_debaters> debates <A2_com_co-agent_person_debated_against> on <A1_ppt_theme_thing_discussed> in <AM_loc__location> place

events.name: collusion
events.definition: secretive cooperation or deceitful agreement in order to deceive others, which may involve unions, wage fixing, kickbacks, or misrepresenting the independence of the relationship between the colluding parties
events.template: <A0_pag_agent_focussed_party> colluded with <A1_com_co-agent_second_party> over <A2_ppt_theme_conspiracy> in <AM_loc__location> place

events.name: disinformation
events.definition: false or misleading information that is spread deliberately to deceive
events.template: <A0_pag__misinformer> attempted to deceived <A1_gol__misinformed> by spreading <A2_ppt__misinformation> in <AM_loc__location> place

events.name: foreign electoral intervention
events.definition: activity by one nation to interfere in the electoral process of another sovereign nation
events.template: <A0_pag__nosy_individual> foreign country intervenes in <A1_ppt__intervene_in> elections in <AM_loc__location> place

events.name: endorsement
events.definition: person's written or spoken statement extolling the virtue of a product, service, or person's qualifications
events.template: <A0_pag__supporter> announces their support of <A1_ppt__thing/person_supported> and testifies that <A1_ppt__thing/person_supported> is qualified for <A2_prp__for_what>, in <AM_loc__location> place

events.name: monitoring
events.definition: systematic recording, measurement, observation or surveillance of a process using technical tools or other observation systems
events.template: <A0_pag_agent_observer> looks closely at <A1_loc_location_thing_looked_at> process in <AM_loc__location> place, to ensure there are no <A2_ppt_theme_looking_for_what> problems

events.name: vote counting
events.definition: process of counting votes in an election
events.template: <A0_pag_agent_counter> counts <A1_ppt_theme_thing_counted> votes at place <AM_loc__location>, and the current count is <A2_prd__Count_itself>

events.name: political campaign
events.definition: attempt to influence the decision making process within a specific group
events.template: <A0_pag__campaigner> attempts to achieve <A1_ppt__cause_goal> in <AM_loc__location> place

events.name: victory
events.definition: success in a competition
events.template: <A0_pag__the_victor> wins the <A2_ppt__the_competition> at location <AM_loc__location>, and the <A1_vsp__the_loser> loses

events.name: Competition
events.definition: This frame is concerned with the idea that people (Participant_1, Participant_2, or Participants) participate in an organized, rule-governed activity (the Competition) in order to achieve some advantageous outcome (often the Prize).  Rank and Score are different criteria by which the degree of achievement of the advantageous outcome is judged.  'He and I played tennis.'
events.template: <A0_pag_agent_competitor> competes with <A1_com_co-agent_opponent> over <A3_ppt__subject_matter_of_the_competition> to achieve <A2_prp__prize> in <AM_loc__location> place

events.name: failure
events.definition: state or event of not meeting a desirable or intended objective, relative to a particular observer or belief system
events.template: <A0_pag__loser> lost <A1_ppt__battle> to <A2_gol__winner> in <AM_loc__location> place
